[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Staking: Pool address] [Pool existence] Do delegated stake functions verify the pool actually exists on-chain before creating identifiers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Staking: Stake transitions] [State consistency] Can attackers query intermediate states during stake transitions (active→pending_inactive→inactive) to gain unfair information? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Staking: Commission & rewards] [Unauthorized queries] Can non-operators query commission or rewards for validators they don't operate? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Staking: Multiple pools] [Pool confusion] Can an address be delegated to multiple pools simultaneously, and do the identifiers handle this correctly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Type system: Eq/PartialEq] [Equality bypass] Are the Eq implementations for all types cryptographically safe, or could attackers create distinct identifiers that compare as equal? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Type system: Clone] [Deep copy] Do Clone implementations properly deep-copy all nested data, or could shared references cause mutation bugs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Type system: Serialize/Deserialize] [Serialization round-trip] Is serialization→deserialization guaranteed to preserve all semantic meaning, or could data be lost/changed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Documentation: Sub-account address field] [Semantic overloading] The documentation says address can be 'stake', 'stake-<operator>', or pool-related - is this overloading clearly documented to prevent misuse? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Documentation: Fake hash] [Security warning] Is it clearly documented that BlockIdentifier.hash is NOT a cryptographic hash and shouldn't be used for security verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Documentation: Sub-account types] [Type enumeration] Is there a complete list of all valid sub-account types, or could new types be added without validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Test: Malformed inputs] [Negative testing] Do tests cover malformed addresses, invalid pool addresses, and other error cases comprehensively? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Test: Operator extraction] [Parse testing] Does test_sub_account_id() test all edge cases of operator address parsing including malformed 'stake-' strings? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Test: Type classification] [Mutual exclusion tests] Are there tests verifying that an identifier can't simultaneously be multiple types (e.g., both total_stake and operator_stake)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Test: Delegated stakes] [Delegation testing] Are delegated stake variants (active, inactive, pending_inactive) thoroughly tested with various pool addresses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Test: Commission and rewards] [New feature testing] Are commission and rewards sub-account types adequately tested given they seem to be newer additions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Memory: String allocations] [Memory exhaustion] Can attackers cause excessive memory allocation by sending very long address, hash, or network strings in identifiers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Memory: Clone operations] [Amplification] Could repeated cloning of large identifier structures be used for memory amplification attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Error: AccountAddress parsing] [Error granularity] Does str_to_account_address() provide specific error messages for different failure modes (invalid hex, wrong length, etc.)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Error: Operator extraction] [Error information] When operator_address() fails, does the error message reveal information about internal account structure? (Low)
